page.title: 15The Telegraph and Argus
page.content: The Bradford Daily Telegraph was the first daily newspaper to be published in Bradford in 1868, when it sold for one halfpenny. It was amalgamated with the Yorkshire Evening Argus in 1926. It is published by Bradford and District Newspapers along with two weekly papers, the Bradford Star and the Target. The Telegraph and Argus Office in Bingley has a staff of nine, including two reporters and a photographer. They are responsible for covering the news in Bingley and surrounding villages. The Target is delivered free to over 33 000 houses. In the edition of the Target, 16th May, six pages were taken up with reports of the disastrous fire at Bradford City football ground where 55 people died and over 100 were injured.
